website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive, simple bike that works great on level terrain.
pros: Brightly colored bicycle that's easy for motorists to see
Available in 3 sizes and multiple color combinations
Perfect for those who don't encounter a lot of hills
Tires built to withstand less than ideal road conditions

customer_reviews.title: You cannot beat the quality of this bike for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a stop gap between my old bike literally falling apart and saving up for a nicer bike. But I am impressed, I have had it for about 2 years and it has been a solid bike. I usully ride about 10 miles a day and while this bike needs to be lubed up more often than other bikes I have owned, it has been fantastic to ride. I replaced the brake pads immediately, but other than that I have no real costs for upkeep. I would recommend this bike to anyone who needs one asap for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: I did a thing once

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my single speed Fixie!
customer_reviews.text: I love my bike! I was able to get this for almost half the price that the local bike shops around me were asking for similar types. Granted, I did have to put it together myself... But it was well worth it for the price break and I did take it to a local nonprofit to wnsure that it was safe to ride. I highly recommend this bike. Great for urban city life.
customer_reviews.author: Tasneem89

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this bike, go ahead and buy new inner tubes. Once you have good quality tubes, this bike is awesome. I ended up selling it to a Filipino friend who wanted to send it home as a gift to his son. But I really enjoyed it while I had it. Did a few races and was amazed at how well I kept up with the higher Multi gear bikes. Of course I couldn't keep up with them when it came crunch time, but I did that was the people who really did this stuff with a passion.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good for Short Commutes
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions were a bit difficult to figure out, but I've been happy with the bike since putting it together. I'm a college student, and I bought the bike to commute between classes and my apartment. It's quick, fairly light, and looks great. I only have two complaints. One, the seat is a bit uncomfortable. Two, I had to replace a wheel when the nozzle for filling up the tire broke. Other than that, it's been great over the past year. (Note: be careful to buy the right size frame. Check a few cycling websites to find out what's right for your height and leg length.)
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Great affordability bike
customer_reviews.text: Very troubling to put together! Left brakes does not work at all & even fell off while riding. My right brake is only useable until I have a chance to actually take my bike to the shop to repair the brake. The air valves are not common so 90% of the air pumps you try to use will not attach correctly but air is still able to inflate tires. This bike is only 1 gear & if you are not an avid cyclist then going up hills will be a bit troublesome. Great bike for affordability.
customer_reviews.author: javien.dawson

customer_reviews.title: It is late review...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my son when he went college but now he has graduated. He had used if through his college years no problem. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: M. lee

customer_reviews.title: The brakes themselves were pretty weak too
customer_reviews.text: It's certainly cheap for a new bike. However, as someone with smaller hands, I found the brake levers were really difficult to squeeze and made my hands cramp up. To change the brake levers, I would have had to change the whole handlebar, which would have been a difficult process because the parts are not generic in the states. Standard handlebars don't work. The brakes themselves were pretty weak too. I've seen lots of people on this bike, who look pretty happy on it. Just know that you need bigger hands and that standard parts likely won't work if you're trying to change something out.
customer_reviews.author: UncreativeName

customer_reviews.title: Great Cheap Single Speed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep at my house in Hawaii. I used to bring my road bike back and forth with me, but the airline fees 1 way were more than this bike cost delivered. I haven't owned a single speed since I was a little kid in the early 60's. For the most part, I love this bike. It's solid, comfortable and excluding the stock inner-tubes, very reliable. My only complaint is the "very cheap" brakes, but I have replaced them. For under $200 this is a great bike for flat surfaces. The island of Oahu is quite hilly and climbing on this bike requires a lot of work, so be prepared if you live in a hilly area.
customer_reviews.author: Dave_B

customer_reviews.title: this is a beautiful bike. I've ridden mine for a few years ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a beautiful bike. I've ridden mine for a few years and have really grown to like it. If you're looking for a bike to commute or ride casually, especially if you're a teenager, this is a perfect bike. It's comes as a fairly reliable stock bike and allows for so much improvement and creativity. Sidenote*** I would highly recommend changing the rims. My front one bent mid-ride after about 4 months of very casual use and I flew over the handle bars like I was shot out of a canon.
customer_reviews.author: The1ofmany

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value! Best bike I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5' 10" and 160 lbs. Fantastic bike! Rode this bike for over 1.5 years and just took it into Manhattan last week, it preformed amazingly! Best bike I've ever owned, and very simple to maintain because of the single speed nature. I like the fix feature, but I live in a mountainy area, so I don't use that setting. Great bike!
customer_reviews.author: Heemoii

customer_reviews.title: Great start for converting to a fixie
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, sturdy and dependable. If you never rode a fixie I suggest riding in 5th gear build a tolerance.
customer_reviews.author: S. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike for the price. Bike comes approximalty 85% assembled already. All you have to do is attach handle bars, pedals and seat as well as tighten up the brakes and pump air into the tires. All together it takes less than 15 mins if you have the right tools. A torque wrench is very useful for assembly to make sure you properly tighten the handle bars and pedals to 20lbs of force. Bike rides real smooth and since the tires are bright yellow you are easily seen at night. Bike weighs about 26lbs so its not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.....some cheap parts.
customer_reviews.text: This has a dual gear...it has to be mechanically flipped via tools, but there is also a freewheel gear for coasting and easier for pedaling up hills. Brake pads SUCK on this.." They grab...... Just not the kind of power you might need for a sudden stop or swerve. Also, Ithe kickstand doesn't fit tightly to the frame. I find myself catching my foot while riding on the kickstand or the excess in the brake lines.
customer_reviews.author: Sonsofvegas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wheels
customer_reviews.text: I find this bike a bit difficult to handle, possible because of the size. I opted for the 57cm version but wish I went for the 54cm. I'm 6'0" so I think you should not even consider the 57 unless you're 6'2" at least or have unusually long legs. Otherwise it's a nice bike although keep in mind that the single speed makes it terrible on city streets. I'd never ride this on the road, it's built more for paved trails. If you don't have access to one, then don't bother and go with something with gears.
customer_reviews.author: Psamathos

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This bike looks and rides great. You get what you pay for though...it clearly is a cheap bike as things are just not high quality. But if you live in a city where bike theft is a common problem you don't want to spend a ton but you also don't want a piece of junk, and this bike fits that bill like a glove. I took all the stickers off, added fenders, removed the back brake and replaced the front with a much more high-quality deal, and bought a light for the front and back. Now it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: scott brown

customer_reviews.title: The bike so far is a good bike. only thing wrong is my tire wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike so far is a good bike. only thing wrong is my tire wouldn't fit between the brake pads. I'm not a bike mechanic so i didn't know how to space the brakes. I had to take it to a bike mechanic I got some new brake pads.He even had trouble with it. I hate to say this but, You could go to Wal Mart and get a bike just as good and save money. They have the same type of bikes there just with different stickers. They should put better brakes on it for the money you spend or make sure the front brakes are not to tight.
customer_reviews.author: Quintin P.

customer_reviews.title: fast, light, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was my first road bike, very affordable. Assembly was very straight forward, you'll be up and running in 30 minutes! If you want to go fixie instead of single speed, just remove the rear wheel and flip it. I liked mine but the saddle was causing pain after riding. It's possible because I'm 5'7 and the frame is for 5'8 and up. Definitely get the correct size and don't make the mistake I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tam

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed. It a good bike to buy if you ...
customer_reviews.text: It was decent for a few months. The brakes wore insanely fast. Here is the kicker, the tube keeps getting flat. I think it is the rim that is causing the issue. I replaced the tube 3 times already and still no luck of it staying pumped. I can no longer use this bike unless I buy a new rim which is the cost of half the bike.... Extremely disappointed. It a good bike to buy if you only want to use it for 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mango

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, a mediocre bike with a below average ride.
customer_reviews.text: Well, firstly the bike was shipped with no peddles but customer service was pretty helpful with that. The bike is not that great as it stands but once you factor in the price its pretty good. It can become something much better if you change the wheel set and crank but if you're going to do that your better off buying a little more expensive. You get what you pay for, a mediocre bike with a below average ride.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Amazon was great and the return process was hassle free
customer_reviews.text: First one I got wouldn't hold air in the tires. Luckily, Amazon was great and the return process was hassle free. They rushed me a replacement, which worked perfectly. As others have mentioned, I would recommend making sure everything is tightened up and fit to your preferences before taking the bike out. Also, being new to road bikes, the thin tires take a little getting used to. I'm sure there are better bikes out there if you really want to drop the money, but I've been happy with this one as a casual rider.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Love the ride
customer_reviews.text: So light in comparison to the mountain bikes I'm accustomed to riding. The seat is rather uncomfortable and after riding several miles, it causes a pain that lasts a few days. Needless to say, I changed the seat to a gel seat. The bike has great speed with little ease but tackling hills is tiring. Lol. Only because there are no gears. Long story short, I am very happy with the bike and the purchase process. I ordered it on a Wednesday and received it on a Friday, just in time for a biking event that I planned.
customer_reviews.author: J Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Love my Kabuto
customer_reviews.text: This is my second go around with the Takara Kabuto. I had the black and yellow one during my senior year of college. Really loved the ride and how low maintenance it was for me. Bought the blue and green one because of the flashy colors and how much I missed riding. Definitely recommend it if youre looking for a zippy way of getting around and one that is very affordable. I would however recommend getting the bike professionally tuned for about 30 bucks if youre a novice like myself. It makes a big difference in ride.
customer_reviews.author: saad moheet

customer_reviews.title: ... bike I've used since my childhood and I Absolutely love this bike
customer_reviews.text: First bike I've used since my childhood and I Absolutely love this bike. Sizing is a little off, I'm a 5'10 female and purchased a large frame and it's a close fit. If you legs were any shorter it could be diffficult to dismount. Overall I am very happy and comfortable using this bike for casual riding. The colors are true to advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bike for about 3 months now. I was never a bike rider before I bought this but I was a swimmer, a runner, and other miscellaneous cardiovascular activities man. I picked this up as a beginner bike and it's great! I live in New Orleans where the city isn't exactly "smooth" but this baby can take the impact and give the speed! Amazon was very reliable in their guarantee of customer satisfaction!!
customer_reviews.author: SaxMan

customer_reviews.title: great city bike.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this bike to take to the gym. Its about 5miles each way. Mostly flat with some slight incline. The bike was easy and quick to assemble, with no issues or bad instructions. I rode it the same day. I did remove the foot straps and the decals however. After some tweaking I was off. It rides easy and comfortably. As I have ony had it for a week and taken only four trips, so far so great. The color is great and it does get looks. For the price I would have to say its great.
customer_reviews.author: Cochise

customer_reviews.title: it has its trade offs but its great
customer_reviews.text: Breaks go bad quickly and chain rusts fast without WD40. Otherwise, LOVE the bike. Does its job - stable, fast, comfortable. I just wanted it to whip around my college campus - does it right.
customer_reviews.author: Phil R.

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike and use it to commute around the ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike and use it to commute around the city that I live in on a regular basis. I keep it switched to the single-speed (not much of a fixie rider). The only downside is that the handlebars will occasionally become loose and swivel easier.. I have "fixed" this by having the tool on hand to tighten them whenever I notice them loosening.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda S Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike.
customer_reviews.text: Lost weight. Have fun with the kids at the park. Just wish I bought a medium size bike. I’m 5’11. So hope that helps for your decision.
customer_reviews.author: Mario rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a low maintenance commuter bike for college. For the price point,this bike is holding up really well and looks great. One of the handle grips comes loose very often; however, I think my roommate may have knocked the bike over (and not told me) causing damage to the clamp so it might not be a quality issue. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a pretty quick single speed without a lot of unnecessary bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mcvaney

customer_reviews.title: otherwise just enjoy the ride
customer_reviews.text: At least bi weekly go through and make sure everything is tight, otherwise just enjoy the ride, I've gotten tons of compliments for this inexpensive and B.A ride of mine. I love this bike and wouldn't trade it for anything less than a new $500 bike, it truly Is an exceptional deal!
customer_reviews.author: H Ritz

customer_reviews.title: I will say--this bike is really cool in appearance
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I will say--this bike is really cool in appearance, great colors. Felt a little cheap in putting it together and had to run out for a couple small missing parts. If a great looking bike of mediocre quality is what you're looking for--riding around the neighborhood etc., this is it and will save money over a more serious road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Wiltshire

customer_reviews.title: I truly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome, It's not the fastest one or has the best quality but for the price that you pay is more than enough. It's been almost 6 months that I've owned it and it's still perfect. I ride my bike 5 to 6 days a week to school and work like 2 hours a day and never had any problems. If you are looking for a cheap bike, with good quality, this is the perfect choice.
customer_reviews.author: Thiago Marques

customer_reviews.title: cheap bike good for flat areas
customer_reviews.text: I live in a very hilly city. The brakes need to go ASAP. I took this for a ride and could not stop on a hill... only slow down very slowly. I swapped out the breaks and the bike worked fine. Tires could use an upgrade also but this would be fine for a flat town. I was just sad that I had to change the brakes on a new bike. Luckily i had free bike parts and extra tires so I didn't have to buy anything extra.
customer_reviews.author: jermain jones

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bike for the most part
customer_reviews.text: Great starter bike for the most part. Bought 54cm for my husband as an early father's gift present. He rides about 10 miles and longer daily. He says he enjoys the smooth ride at 15-18 mph on the road. Cons: Brakes are sub par in stopping especially in emergency situations. Heavy side for those in cycling world not used to lifting weights
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Decent Bike
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to think about a single speed bike. However, I am getting used to it and its fun. The handle bar tape was damaged in shipping. there were scratches on the frame. Otherwise, I was able to get it together in about 30 minutes. I wished the rear wheel shipped in the opposite mode. I had to take the rear tire off and flip it around for the floating spin mode. this should have been standard. For $200 its a nice bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, solid bike. Excellent for commuting because of the heavy frame and you will not find a better price. If you are in the market for an entry-level road bike, this is a great choice. I had never assembled a bike and this could not have been easier. The stickers should come in a pack on the side because the Takara stickers look silly but are easy enough to take off. Like others have said, get ready for the compliments. If I had to describe this bike in one word, it would be: FRESH.
customer_reviews.author: T James

customer_reviews.title: Good bike
customer_reviews.text: Good) Handles well. Sick looking colour. Easy to assemble. Bads) Gets dirty quickly( it has been a month and the handlebars look dirty already) Seat is very limited in adjustment. Riding on minimum setting and i am 5' 5", which means the stock lights cannot be installed. Wheels lose air, about 10 PSI in a week, 5 days riding. Sick looking colour, easily stolen by crooks. Must lock front wheel and frame, separately. Also chain your seat. Duct tape your stickers, so it looks undesirable. Most importantly, don't park at same spot everyday. NYC, male, 18.
customer_reviews.author: Ka Mok

customer_reviews.title: Great single speed bike
customer_reviews.text: Great single speed bike that can switch from single to fixed speed by switching back wheel, definitely looks better taking off the stickers, nice clean black look with bright tires will certainly make you easy to see with traffic, seat is soft, no problem with long rides Pros: -fast bike -single speed Cons: -you have to assemble it yourself
customer_reviews.author: L.K.

customer_reviews.title: This ain't my first rodeo!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of Fixies before that came in around the same price point and this one is by far the best. The only things I did were peel off the stickers (super easy) and have the wheels trued. The wheel situation was pretty bad (un-ridable) but what do you expect from banged out on a machine wheels? It's a little heavy but really ... who gives flip? It's a Steel framed Fixed Gear! Other than that this bike is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Drye

customer_reviews.title: Great Road Bike
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bike now for almost one year. I ride it around the neighborhood and put about four to six miles on it most evenings or mornings when I ride nothing too outragious but its just right for me and fairly comfortable to ride. Not a major bike rider or enthusiast but just for a bike to ride around the neighborhood or road it would be a very nice bike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and defective screws and bolts! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Other buyers were NOT joking when they said the screws and bolts were made from cheap parts! DO NOT BUY! Front brake broke apart when tightening!
customer_reviews.author: Dudameister

customer_reviews.title: For the value it's great.
customer_reviews.text: too many modifications required to make it worthwhile. For the value it's great.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiWataru

customer_reviews.title: Now it feels like a cruiser
customer_reviews.text: I switched the bars out with some raised ones. Now it feels like a cruiser. Such a fun bike to ride. Packaging was good, no scratches. Decals came off nice and clean allowing for some custom art.
customer_reviews.author: brian wilson

customer_reviews.title: Decent ride at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Need to continuosly tighten some parts but overall a good bike. I have crashed twice since I have had it and it sustained the abuse pretty well. (Almost got hit by a car). People seem to like the color scheme. I will probably be changing out the tires soon, but they have been good so far. Overal, definitely worth the cost. Great intro bike.
customer_reviews.author: Motts

customer_reviews.title: Not for a pro, but the rest of us can't complain for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am posting a very positive review because of the price I got it at--$135--which is insanely cheap for any bike. So far it rides well, which is all I can ask for the price. While I get the sense that the flashy yellow on the tires and handle bar is going to fade pretty quickly, again I can't complain with such a reasonable price tag. So far I haven't noticed a loose chain as other reviewers have mentioned, but all chains naturally stretch with use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander the Average

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great value & limited assembly required. Great feel. Easy to adjust. Colours work well together. Of course everyone asks if I'm a Seahawks fan, but that's ok. Highly recommend this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Brit  Engbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing take it everywhere looks cool too
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing take it everywhere looks cool too. I did remove the decals which requires some adhesive remover or it will hold dirt, I did upgrade the brakes the standard ones are a little weak, but hey the money I saved on buying this thing didn't matter much to me.
customer_reviews.author: Izilla

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I ride it in a city and it works and look pretty good. It was easy to set up. It's not the greatest and I would have given it 3.5 stars if that was an option. While I guess it's solid for its money it feels a little cheap and I will probably spend more for a better bike next time.
customer_reviews.author: ColleenG

customer_reviews.title: Took 20 seconds of each mile
customer_reviews.text: This bicycle is great. I have been riding the past two years on my Trek geared Mountain bike. I do 15 miles average on a normal day. My first ride getting used to the fixed gear I was not pushing very hard, I easliy shaved 20 seconds off each mile. Now that Ive had the bike for a while when I pushing I can take off a minute each mile. Yes the tire size makes a huge difference, but this bike on a smooth road is like glass. I would point out to check and tighten all connections at least once a week, Like all bikes say anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Mark

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool...
customer_reviews.text: Had it professionally built at a local bike shop but the pieces continue to fall off and there is no cushion or shocks to make the ride smooth enough for road use. Looks cool but isn't for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah R. Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for its price!
customer_reviews.text: for a cheap bike it is great! I have had it for three months now, it is light, fast and looks good as well. For any beginners this is a great bike. I recommend it because i have had a good experience
customer_reviews.author: andres idrovo

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Reliable Commuter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike mainly because it was relatively inexpensive. I have a three mile ride into town from my house, and a seven mile ride to work, and driving seems like a waste. Honestly, once I had it assembled, this has been a great commuter bike. I am 6'3" and the large version is fine for me. This is a great basic bike for short rides and flat commutes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have to say that this is a great simple horse
customer_reviews.text: after two years of use and many km, I have to say that this is a great simple horse. Quality is on par with the price. You can't expect it as good as 1400 dollar Giant bike, but for regular commute, it works great. My son is 110 kg and no problems with the bike so far.
customer_reviews.author: Go Bitcoin

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike to use on the commute from my apartment in the city to work/university. After using it for about a month here's my take away: great bike overall for someone who lives in the city wouldn't recommend buying this bike for trail use. Stick to paved roads and streets definately not a trail bike. Also as many others have pointed out the tubes that come with it are complete and total s*** buy new ones ASAP. Also have tools and handy because this bike has a nasty habit of randomly having nuts and bolts come loose. Overall for the price it's a great bike as long as you replace the awful tubes that come in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade from mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike a couple of weeks ago and have been riding it to work every day since. Assembly was fairly straightforward and instructions were accurate. It took me about an hour to setup. I like this bike much better than the mountain bike I was previously using because it is much lighter and faster. The single speed is just right for me, not too taxing on the hills and great on the flat. I'm 6' 2" and the 57" bike I got is the perfect size for me. I'm not a biking fanatic and this bicycle is just to get around town.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The Rings are a bad quality you need to buy a new one but overall the bicycle is great. This bicycle is like a computer that is slow you just need to upgrade some parts and you are good. Trust me you will save a Lot of money, the bicycle i was going to buy was like $700$ and the total i spend for this one was $400
customer_reviews.author: Josean

customer_reviews.title: Sweet project bike
customer_reviews.text: So two months of every day commute riding.. not bad for the pric3.. its a cool lookin fixie and it rides well.. Put bull horn bars.. Chainged brakes.. maybe new wheels in the future. . Not a bad buy with time u can make it a sweet ride ..
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: I've been quite happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought this an an indoor trainer. I've been quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this bike for 1st time biker
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this bike for 1st time biker. You get what you paid for but it's not necessary to be this crappy experience. It does look good & flashy but that's about it. It's quite heavy for biking uphill, and the material is crappy. Save yourself from a huge disappointment and go for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Tai

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your Buck!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike!!!! Bought it over a year ago and ride it constantly. Chose it for the bright yellow, as I like riding to and from the Beach at night. Throw some lights and it's super visible at night. The only draw back is that the tires seem to be have to be reflated every couple of weeks, but I'm sure new tubes will fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Tharguul

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bike! im not much of a bike geek to say much about it but it felt great to ride it.....until someone stole my brand spanking new bike......*Shake my fist* its flashy so be sure to lock it up with heavy duty locks/chains.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond An

customer_reviews.title: Huge rupture in the front tube 3 days after assembling
customer_reviews.text: I took this item out of the box and assembled it. I took it for a spin immediately, and it seemed like it was going to be awesome. But when I took it off my bike rack to go on a ride a few days later, the front tube was completely flat. I took the tube out of the wheel and discovered a huge rupture that wasn't there when I had ridden the previous day. Either it was caused by a jagged edge on the wheel, or the tube was defective. Either way, it was a huge safety hazard. I'm not even sure i want a replacement tube from them because I don't trust them to send me quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cokely

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this bicycle, I had assumed that I would just use it to ride around with my girlfriend through the park and such. How surprised was I when I found that I would be riding it all over town to do little errands?! Ridiculously! Seriously great braking power and an all around excellent commuter bike. Perfect for the navigator of the concrete jungle, and much faster than a car, to boot!
customer_reviews.author: JohnGustas

customer_reviews.title: great value but some issues
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bike for a couple weeks and ride it hard daily. The assembly was easy but I am in engineering student, the directions were awful and not useful at all. The first issue with the brakes, they are awful and need to constantly be adjusted. So far The tubes have been holding up nicely, The bike is heavy, but still fast and has a nice gear ratio for flat riding. The fixed gear setting is awful and I would not recommend this bike if you are getting into that. All in all you get what you pay for with this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: The bike is great but without a torque you can do nothing...
customer_reviews.text: The bike is very good and safe. But I had a hard time to get it started since I don't have a suitable torque. And you need a few different sizes of torques to make it work. If there's a torque in the package, I'll grade it 5.
customer_reviews.author: gordon chen

customer_reviews.title: This bike hurt my feet to turn the wheel its too small for anyone 6' or taller
customer_reviews.text: I disslike the closeness of front wheels proximity to the petals it is dangerous if you like to be able to turn left or right you feet will get stuck under the wheel and hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Takara Kabouto means a nice bike with no breaks
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are so smooth to the point breaks will have no grip at all. I replaced the break pads with custom ones that works great on my wife's bike but didn't do much on this one. The other thing I didn't like was bike is the weight, it's alloy frame but as heavy as steel bikes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Al Rawi

customer_reviews.title: Great High School Teen Boy Bike
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Our teen son assembled it without problem. Quality bike that looks good and rides nice. He's 6 ft and the 57 cm frame fits him perfectly. FYI, The Planet Bike light set (purchased separately) fits this bike well.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Takara
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price. Put a few hundred miles on this thing with no problems. Only real complaints would be I had to change out tires sooner then I would have hoped. I don't know if they are just cheap, or mine were faulty, but they wouldn't hold air after a while. Also, the seat is also the most uncomfortable bike seat I have ever sat on. But for the price, this cant be beat. If I had a do over, I would still buy it.
customer_reviews.author: kevh28

customer_reviews.title: Biked 65 km (40miles) a week for 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I recon I have biked over 1300 km using this bicycle. It looks cool. I love the fixed gear option. I used this as a starter bicycle, I recommend this bicycle for starters, it's competitively priced. I will not buy it again because I am now looking for a bicycle that will bring me out of the city.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Rovala

customer_reviews.title: Missing pedals?  They're on back-order!
customer_reviews.text: The bike shipped timely and in fine condition except it was missing pedals and an allen wrench for assembly. What am I supposed to do without pedals? I called them and emailed my receipt and got an email saying the pedals were back-ordered. The 57cm is also way too big for my height (5'7"). Wish I got the 54cm. And maybe I'm just not used to the handels but they're almost impossible to hold when riding. Otherwise great bike. Hope the return is easy...
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike , Took me 15 mins to set it up. Out of 15 the brakes took 8 mins . But i am not a handy man..
customer_reviews.author: Nita

customer_reviews.title: My first single speed
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get this as the price was awesome. Wasn't disappointed. Was easy to assemble, rides great. Seat isn't the most comfortable and wheels don't have quick release hubs, but for the price, it's a fun ride to add to my collection of bikes
customer_reviews.author: Frederick J. Eichinger

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: there are few reasons i only gave a 4 star is because 1)i bought this bike twice, and the first i received came with no pedals and the front wheel wouldn't fit 2) i'm not an expert in bikes but the back wheel shouldn't be crooked right? i mean its still ride-able... 3)the brakes are not exactly what you call fit into place. overall this is a very nice bike and i plan to keep it for a long time, and amazon is always so helpful since they replaced the one i previously bought with ease.
customer_reviews.author: yoshi

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: yellow fades fast but for the price it looks good and rides ok
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and Old
customer_reviews.text: The bike itself is ok, but for the brakes t came with for me were run down and old. it was damaged and did not work at all(i am talking about front brake)
customer_reviews.author: Bilal Naderi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I read the many positive reviews about how smooth this bike is... I have to say that I am 100% disappointed in this bike. Unlike many reviewers, I did not like the looks of the bike. To me it looks cheap, it rides rough, and the brakes are nothing short of awful. They are extremely hard to squeeze and they simply do not work even after several adjustments. I am giving it 2 stars just because this bike may have just been a lemon but I will not try to find out! I started the return process the day I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Abdelrahman

customer_reviews.title: The Kabuto is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I received this bike, put it together and had it on the road within an hour of opening the box. I purchased the 57cm frame which is working perfectly for me, as I am 6'2, 210lbs. I read some reviews stating that the bike was a tad on the heavy side, but to me its not heavy at all. I easily carry it up stairs going in and out of my building. My only complaint so far is that the shoe clamp's on the pedals are cheap. One of them fell off on my third ride. But this is to be expected at this price point. They are easily replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: DanO

customer_reviews.title: i miss this thing so sad it was stolen
customer_reviews.text: My first bike! i miss this thing so sad it was stolen. easy setup and both fixed gear and regular? gear.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: A STEEL FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS BIKE. Has a lot of stickers but I peeled them off its a clean it rides beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole & Joanna

customer_reviews.title: ... am going to start off by saying I had terrible luck with this bike
customer_reviews.text: I am going to start off by saying I had terrible luck with this bike... Week 1 = Flat tire Week 2 = Chain broke, wrapping around the back gear and spokes causing a lot to break ($60 to replace/fix) Week 3 = Bike lock cut, bike stolen. Sum it all together = bad luck for this kid. All together I didn't even get the chance to fully experience this bike =(
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bicycle. I really like the colors and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bicycle. I really like the colors and the build quality feels very sturdy. I really like the smoothness of the fixed gear. I have been able to tackle some pretty decent hills on this bike too. The one gear it does have is perfect for most of the riding that I do and is a good bike for training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The price was awesome! The bike is easy to install and is ...
customer_reviews.text: As a novice in the sport of biking I wanted to get a starter road bike where I knew I could go on long bike rides. The price was awesome! The bike is easy to install and is very smooth. The only con was that the seat was terribly hard.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great ride for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't road a fixie in 15 years... I really like this bike. Its true that the yellow with obviously get dirty over time but you can always replace the tape and tires for black. No complains... nice ride
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: the color is really cool, bike definately stands
customer_reviews.text: got this bike for my boyfriend he loves it! the color is really cool , bike definately stands out
customer_reviews.author: AshleyAO

customer_reviews.title: Noce
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this bike, I really enjoyed it. It lasted about 2.5 years until the fork broke while I was riding it and I fell off. I guess it's good for the price. I don't know if I'll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Trend Setter
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike and I ride it everywhere! I swear, I was the only person on campus with this bike, but by the end of summer, there were at least 4 more. This is a beautiful bike. Now I just need to add gears.
customer_reviews.author: WhoElse

customer_reviews.title: takara kabuto
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bike sorta flashy. Need to be at least 5'7" to ride it or i believe. Cant really say anything bad about the bike. Its cheap it rides well and overall i used it to its full potential. I like to note that the stickers on the bike are removable so those who want a clean nice look can have that. Really the only problem i had with this bike is that the pedals are kind of sharp so you can get scratched by that. that's really it as long as you are careful or if you replace the pedals i think you are fine.
customer_reviews.author: dt

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brake cable too short causing caliper having to be disengaged to function properly
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: ... 5"10 210 pounds and the bike holds me haha pretty suprized my self the wheels they come with have ...
customer_reviews.text: Awsome bike im 5"10 210 pounds and the bike holds me haha pretty suprized my self the wheels they come with have popped but i replaced them and has been great since
customer_reviews.author: Miguel pulido

customer_reviews.title: It's a good cheap bike
customer_reviews.text: It's a good cheap bike. Come on, what do you expect from 200$ bike? Yes, it's nice, it's ok, it's bright I love it. But it's not perfect. If you're a bike geek (you ride everyday) spend more money and get a better bike. If you a regular user, yeah it's a very good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best money I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: This was my first road bike and I have had it for about a year now. Some of the best money I ever spent. I go riding with friends with much better bikes and am able to keep up. Has needed no maintenance, though I keep it indoors. The brake handles feel a touch awkward to me, but I am new to road bikes and don't know if this is general. Still, so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much like everyone else said, this is a good bike. I want to mention that this bike is a lot heavier than normal road bikes, so don't expect to race with it other than that it has preformed well.
customer_reviews.author: MCM

customer_reviews.title: Worth every buck
customer_reviews.text: This bike is worth every dollar. While most road bikes go way beyond the retail price of this particular model, this one provides the quality comparable to the best road bikes around. The bike is a great height for anyone around 5'6" to 5"10 and is excellent for everyday use. I ride it to school each and everyday. Not only is it reliable, it is also an eye-catcher. The yellow is very bright and contrasts beautifully with the black. The best features include the flip-flop hub which makes the bike a "fixie" and it's lightweight frame.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Did my first triathlon on this bike, then another! Perfect for beginners. Yes do change the tubes though before using it or you WILL end up with a flat!
customer_reviews.author: Twintastic

customer_reviews.title: Inner Tube exploded on me
customer_reviews.text: The bike itself seems well-built. However, the inner tube exploded on me. I did not even go to the recommended PSI yet ( I was around 40 PSI) when the tube exploded. But I contacted Takara and they are sending another tube.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Abishek

customer_reviews.title: Rides fine, but components are shoddy
customer_reviews.text: I've put quite a few bikes together, and this one was very easy as single speeds go. However, after a nice quick ride to check my stability, I went to true my wheel and adjust my breaks. Adjusting the breaks yielded a broken center bolt to the front break console. I wasn't torquing the bolt too hard and wasn't even close to tightening it all the way, so you'll want to be careful with this. I'm pleased with the bike as a whole, but I'm not pleased that I already have to replace such an essential component.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Weyenberg

customer_reviews.title: I had my bike operating within two days and it is great. For the price
customer_reviews.text: This bike met all of my expectations. It took a little while to set up, and if you don't have the right kind of wrench you will need to go buy one. But, I had my bike operating within two days and it is great. For the price, you can't beat this deal. Good quality. It is an excellent ride, and I use it everyday. It flies too!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Good Parts
customer_reviews.text: This bike was shipped like it was stated on the website but the small frame (54cm) is much too compacted for the wheels. when I turn left or right on the bike it hits my foot which can cause one to fall off their bike. The parts are great but all of it together on the 54cm frame is not so great. I wish they would have appropriated the correct proportion to frame size and wheel size. But for $150 dollars you get what you pay for right?....
customer_reviews.author: Jai

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: looks sheek ride is smooth durable material cons: tires need air too often and I don't even ride it that much ( like a couple times a month) stickers were tacky so I removed them, which was a pain
customer_reviews.author: beachlady5

product_meta.title: Takara Kabuto Single Speed Road Bike
product_meta.description: The kabuto is all about keeping things simple and getting it done without breaking the bank. At the heart of the kabuto you-feet ll find a strong hand crafted steel frame with Horizontal dropouts that can handle the abuse of the big city. City riders told us that they didn't - feel need derailleur-feet's so we listened and outfitted the kabuto with a flip Flop bug so you can run it as a fixed gear or in standard freewheel single speed Mode without having to worry about adjustments to temperamental components. The 32 hole alloy wheels roll on loud Kenda 700 x 32 tires that are capable of withstanding less than perfect roads. Front and rear alloy side pull brakes round out this spectacular model.
feature_bullets: Rear Flip Flop hub for Fixed gear or Freewheel
Tig-welded steel frame and Fork; alloy rims with alloy hub; alloy side pull Brakes

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
